headline: New Details Emerge On Sudden Death of “Foo Fighters” Drummer Taylor Hawkins
author: Missy Crane
sentences: “According to those close to him, the death could be related to the consumption of drugs,” the Metropolitan Police of Bogota said in a statement published by several news outlets in the South American nation and reported by the Mirror of London.
After all, it was the “Foo Fighters” who first came out with a requirement that anyone who went to their show had to show proof of vaccination.
Hawkins, 50, was found dead in a hotel room at the Casa Medina in Bogota, Colombia, Friday, where heartbroken fans gathered outside in shock.
The Foo Fighters backed out of their scheduled Friday performance at the Picnic Stereo Festival in Bogotá shortly after announcing the death.
The New York Post reported that the shocking death of Foo Fighters drummer Taylor Hawkins could be related to drugs, authorities said.
Hawkins, an electrifying performer with a stage presence that projected from behind his drum kit, had a history of known drug use.
He overdosed on heroin in 2001 and spent a week in a coma, just four years after joining the Foo Fighters, according to The Sun.
Many fans were shocked to hear of the news that “Foo Fighters” legendary drummer Taylor Hawkins had died at only 50-years-old.
However, now, local authorities are speaking out, and they’re claiming that the death may be drug-related.
There’s been an alarming number of people who’ve had heart-related issues since the start of the vaccine.
Hopefully, the family will get the answers they need on Mr. Hawkin’s death, so they can find closure.
So, that has led many people to wonder if maybe he had a bad reaction to the vaccine?
Many are also wondering if he was having “chest paints” thanks to the vaccine?
Hawkins had complained of chest pains to hotel staff, according to reports.
When the news first broke, there was no indication of how Taylor died.
The incident happened while the band was on tour in South America.
“The cause of death has yet to be established,” police cautioned.
Taylor died inside a hotel room in Bogota, Colombia.
